text: hopefully at some point we will look
back and wish that more people had given
up a bit of time to stand up for those
who had no rights I mean we look back at
those who helped abolish the slave trade
and we're so grateful for them but they
stood up for people who weren't
considered equal human beings and I
think sometime in the future people will
think the same about those who helped
abolish abortion
so we're going to stand outside and Mary
Stopes abortion Center this is quite a
busy abortion clinic
so yes here we are
pray for the women who are who have a
appointment scheduled to that day for
the women who are in the abortion clinic
for the staff who are there and for any
passers-by that we might encounter for
as long as I can remember I've always
felt very strongly about pro-life issues
I suppose
injustice is something that fires a lot
of people up and I feel that this is one
of the greatest in Justices that there
is that people are treated as though
they are not even human beings that they
are denied the right to life I know one
of the first times I went to the
abortion clinic as part of the 40 Days
for Life
there was a woman walking past on the
other side of the road young woman I
think she was 19 years old and she just
stopped and she said to me why weren't
you here last week if you'd been here
last week I wouldn't have had my
abortion and that just really really
touched my heart and it just made me
think you know I am where I'm supposed
to be because this is just what we need
to be doing it's just for women like
that that we need to be here
I think it would be a waste of time us
being outside the abortion clinic if we
weren't going to provide we on
alternatives to women we very much
therefore women after they've had
abortions as well we're not there in the
spirit of judgment or anger but if
they've had we want them to find peace
at times I do feel misunderstood feeling
part of the pro-life movement sometimes
we are portrayed as being judgmental
towards women which is so far from the
truth I don't judge any woman who has an
abortion I might judge the the act of
having an abortion is wrong but I don't
judge that individual who's made that
choice I think a lot of people when they
hear of the word protest they imagine
people standing outside the Mu Shu
clinic maybe shouting maybe holding
placards that might say you know things
like murder or something on them I would
I would hate to be part of a movement
like that I would find that quite
shocking love has got to be at the
center of it
only God knows whether I won't always do
this or not
if if abortion is legal and if there are
women seeking abortions I will always be
there trying to help them find
alternatives
